User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; rv:8.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/8.0.1
Build ID: 20111120135848

Steps to reproduce:

Currently the add-ons management is in a different menu item by itself. Intuitively it should be in the Preferences menu. 

Also the UI for the add-ons management is much nicer than the pop-up window used for the "Preferences" menu item. 




Expected results:

Merge the "Preferences" and "Add-ons" menu items with the UI of the "Add-ons". Just to be clear - 

- There should be only one menu item to change preferences and it should be called "Preferences"
- The "Preferences" menu item should really open up as a new tab in firefox and not a new window.
